{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3565375,"name":"Corey Applegate","username":"Corey_Applegate","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/corey_applegate/{size}/250858_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T14:44:07.423Z","cooked":"

We struggled last night on building more complex auto commands while trying to parallel some functions.

Our Events triggers are the firsts things defined in the Robotcontainer.java constructor and before we call the autobuilder.

Non of the Event triggers require the drivetrain.

We have 5 paths defined sudo names [start-F, F-source, source-D, D-source, source-C]

When these paths are run bare bones in sequence with no commands or Event triggers the all exicute and complete as expected.

Adding an Event trigger to path 1 to start rasing the elevator and arm works as expected. We can usually build this first step to score.

When we start adding Event triggers to the next path is when things start to go badly. Adding a Event trigger that runs a new Command that presets the elevator abs arm mid path causes the path and Auto to abort.

We have reverted to using only paths bundled in parallel commands that have a sequence command wrapping wait times and registered named commands. This methodology is working is just a few of us professionals feed a bit dirty reverting to timer based sequences vs Event

Code can be found here . Main is the current time based auto. In the rbcontainer are commented Event trggers. GitHub - FRC4607/Comp-Bot-2025-Phantom

One question i have is can the same Event trigger be used in multiple path in the same Auto? Or dose each Event trigger need to be unique even if it call the same command?

Each has to be unique. Every event marker is just telling the robot to do something at a certain specific point or timestamp in the path.

Also you have a race command in your code that appear to race an alignment command with a wait command, and I assume that the wait command wins that race and finishes faster?
